CONCEPT.LABEL: entity
CONCEPT.DEF: Something which exists independently of others.

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.class_constraint: evt:時間区分(time interval) | time point

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.class_constraint: evt:時間区分(time interval) | time point

SUB_L.label: 実在物
SUB_L.def: Something which exists independently of others.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quality_1
CONCEPT.DEF: The concept "quality" does not appear under this type. Instead, "property" corresponds to the conventional "quality". It cannot exist alone but always exists dependently on physical things which also need qualities to exist.

SUB_L.label: 質
SUB_L.def: The concept "quality" does not appear under this type. Instead, "property" corresponds to the conventional "quality". It cannot exist alone but always exists dependently on physical things which also need qualities to exist.

CONCEPT.LABEL: space
CONCEPT.DEF: When it is used as a class constraint, it has to be taken "p-space", that is, its subspace(part of the space) is almost equivalent to its subclass. <Kobe is part of Japan>, but <Kobe is-a Japan> is valid as well in the context of region.

SUB_L.label: 空間
SUB_L.def: When it is used as a class constraint, it has to be taken "p-space", that is, its subspace(part of the space) is almost equivalent to its subclass. <Kobe is part of Japan>, but <Kobe is-a Japan> is valid as well in the context of region.

CONCEPT.LABEL: 3D space
CONCEPT.DEF: 3D spaceR is a subspace and hence it is part-of 3D space. At the same time, 3D spaceR inherits everything from the class constraint: 3D space.

SLOT.label: slot7
SLOT.DEF: 3D spaceR is a subspace and hence it is part-of 3D space. At the same time, 3D spaceR inherits everything from the class constraint: 3D space.

SUB_L.def: 3D spaceR is a subspace and hence it is part-of 3D space. At the same time, 3D spaceR inherits everything from the class constraint: 3D space.

SUB_L.label: 3D空間
SUB_L.def: 3D spaceR is a subspace and hence it is part-of 3D space. At the same time, 3D spaceR inherits everything from the class constraint: 3D space.

CONCEPT.LABEL: substrate
CONCEPT.DEF: This needs further elaboration. Anyway, this is what entities need to exist in the real world.

SUB_L.label: 基盤
SUB_L.def: This needs further elaboration. Anyway, this is what entities need to exist in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: time
CONCEPT.DEF: Much more sophisticated ontology of time has been developed but is not included here. Please contact Mizoguchi if you are interested in it.

SUB_L.label: 時間
SUB_L.def: Much more sophisticated ontology of time has been developed but is not included here. Please contact Mizoguchi if you are interested in it.

CONCEPT.LABEL: clock time
CONCEPT.DEF: time point

SUB_L.label: 時刻
SUB_L.def: time point

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:時間区分(time interval)
CONCEPT.DEF: YAMATOのtime intervalを基にする。 starting time, ending timeの制約に、date|yearを追加。

CONCEPT.LABEL: object
CONCEPT.DEF: It is unitary and non-dissective, that is, it exists as a whole. It needs substance to constitute itself. It needs an event in which it participates to exist in the real world.

SUB_L.label: オブジェクト
SUB_L.def: It is unitary and non-dissective, that is, it exists as a whole. It needs substance to constitute itself. It needs an event in which it participates to exist in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: physical
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs both 3D space and time to exist. Quality role type is defined here as a role, associated with physical, played by generic quality. "quality instance" is defined as role-holder. In order to refer to quality role type, use "#quality instance". See "human".

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: This is a definition of quality role type at the highest abstraction level. All the quality roles defined in the context of all the subclasses of entity automatically become sub-type of this quality role type. See human in which height is defined.

SUB_L.label: slot
SUB_L.def: This is a definition of quality role type at the highest abstraction level. All the quality roles defined in the context of all the subclasses of entity automatically become sub-type of this quality role type. See human in which height is defined.

SUB_L.label: 具体物
SUB_L.def: It needs both 3D space and time to exist. Quality role type is defined here as a role, associated with physical, played by generic quality. "quality instance" is defined as role-holder. In order to refer to quality role type, use "#quality instance". See "human".

CONCEPT.LABEL: Topological whole
CONCEPT.DEF: Its identity is tightly dependent on the topological relations between constituents.

SUB_L.label: 構造的全体物
SUB_L.def: Its identity is tightly dependent on the topological relations between constituents.

CONCEPT.LABEL: morphological whole
CONCEPT.DEF: It looses its identity when its shape(morpheme) is damaged.

SUB_L.label: 形態的全体物
SUB_L.def: It looses its identity when its shape(morpheme) is damaged.

CONCEPT.LABEL: group
CONCEPT.DEF: The concrete version of set which is abstract. Its identity is determined by its members, that is, if all the member are same, then it keeps its identity, and if the group is same, then the members are same.

SUB_L.label: グループ
SUB_L.def: The concrete version of set which is abstract. Its identity is determined by its members, that is, if all the member are same, then it keeps its identity, and if the group is same, then the members are same.

CONCEPT.LABEL: functional
CONCEPT.DEF: It looses its identity when its function is damaged.

SUB_L.label: 機能物
SUB_L.def: It looses its identity when its function is damaged.

CONCEPT.LABEL: living organism
CONCEPT.DEF: Its function is to do life activity.

SUB_L.label: 生命体
SUB_L.def: Its function is to do life activity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: artifact
CONCEPT.DEF: Its function is given inherently(when it is born). It means not only "man-made thing" but also "agent-made thing" including bird nests.

SUB_L.label: 人工物
SUB_L.def: Its function is given inherently(when it is born). It means not only "man-made thing" but also "agent-made thing" including bird nests.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representing thing
CONCEPT.DEF: This is a physical thing which has "representation" as its part like a copy of a book you can hold. The physical part of "representation form" is put on the medium, and hence the thing becomes a concrete thing. See Book for detail. Note that you can copy "representation by symbols" only after it has become "represented thing". That is, what you can copy is what's on the medium, not representation itself which is a semi-abstract thing. This doesn't apply to 2D representation. See painting.

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: What's on the medium is usually the image part of representation form.

SUB_L.def: What's on the medium is usually the image part of representation form.

SUB_L.label: 表現物
SUB_L.def: This is a physical thing which has "representation" as its part like a copy of a book you can hold. The physical part of "representation form" is put on the medium, and hence the thing becomes a concrete thing. See Book for detail. Note that you can copy "representation by symbols" only after it has become "represented thing". That is, what you can copy is what's on the medium, not representation itself which is a semi-abstract thing. This doesn't apply to 2D representation. See painting.

CONCEPT.LABEL: non-representing thing
CONCEPT.DEF: Ordinary artifacts. Its subclasses are not elaborated yet.

SUB_L.label: 非表現物
SUB_L.def: 普通の人工物

CONCEPT.LABEL: agent
CONCEPT.DEF: It looses its identity when its mind is damaged. Contrary to pseudo-agent, it has mind which controls its intention.

SUB_L.label: エージェント
SUB_L.def: It looses its identity when its mind is damaged. Contrary to pseudo-agent, it has mind which controls its intention.

CONCEPT.LABEL: complex agent
CONCEPT.DEF: This is defined as what enacts the external behavior such as decision making. See [Galton 2009] in detail.

SUB_L.label: 複合エージェント
SUB_L.def: This is defined as what enacts the external behavior such as decision making. See [Galton 2009] in detail.

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:組織(organization)
CONCEPT.DEF: YAMATOのorganizationから作成。 It has controllable intention.

SUB_L.label: 組織
SUB_L.def: It has controllable intention.

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:企業(company)
CONCEPT.DEF: YAMATOのcompanyより。

CONCEPT.LABEL: robot
CONCEPT.DEF: It is kind of joke. Robot is definitely an artifact at this moment. But, it would become real in the future.

SUB_L.class_const: プログラムされた精神

SUB_L.label: ロボット
SUB_L.def: It is kind of joke. Robot is definitely an artifact at this moment. But, it would become real in the future.

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:書物(book)
CONCEPT.DEF:
YAMATOのbookを基にするが、authorと直接に関連付けられる。
This has a publisher but doesn't have authors which belong to abstract book which is the thing written by authors. See abstract book. A book as a represented thing is what you see on the medium(paper or electronic file) as a sequence of icons of characters which constitute the whole text. The book as representation is composed of the sequence of abstract symbols denoted by those icons of characters.

SUB_L.label: 本
SUB_L.def: This has a publisher but doesn't have authors which belong to abstract book which is the thing written by authors. See abstract book. A book as a represented thing is what you see on the medium(paper or electronic file) as a sequence of icons of characters which constitute the whole text. The book as representation is composed of the sequence of abstract symbols denoted by those icons of characters.

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:人物(human)
CONCEPT.DEF: YAMATOのhumanから作成。 Its identity comes from the mind part whose existence is totally dependent on the body part.

SUB_L.label: 人間
SUB_L.def: Its identity comes from the mind part whose existence is totally dependent on the body part.

CONCEPT.LABEL: society
CONCEPT.DEF: Group of agents which share culture as its integrity. The reason why this has no unity is because culture exists every portion of the society.

SUB_L.label: 社会
SUB_L.def: Group of agents which share culture as its integrity. The reason why this has no unity is because culture exists every portion of the society.

CONCEPT.LABEL: stative
CONCEPT.DEF: State-based thing

SUB_L.label: 状態的
SUB_L.def: State-based thing

CONCEPT.LABEL: process_1
CONCEPT.DEF: A unit of process. The nested structure of processes are built(modeled) using the idea of functional decomposition. See [Kitamura 2006] in detail. Essentially open-ended(non-anchored) and time-dependent. By open-ended, I mean neither its beginning nor its termination are sepcified, and hence it is homogeneous(any part of it is the same process). Therefore, a process cannot exist in the real world as an independent one. It necessarily exists associated with an event. <Its instance is put into an event instance to exist in the real world.> Although it has a time interval to specify in what time region it exists, both ends of the interval are excluded, that is, the interval is an open interval. Processes are material of events. Linguistically, it corresponds to verbs, while events to nouns. Consider: to travel and a travel.

SUB_L.def: Just before the intiated time
Just after the terninal time

SUB_L.label: プロセス_1
SUB_L.def: A unit of process. The nested structure of processes are built(modeled) using the idea of functional decomposition. See [Kitamura 2006] in detail. Essentially open-ended(non-anchored) and time-dependent. By open-ended, I mean neither its beginning nor its termination are sepcified, and hence it is homogeneous(any part of it is the same process). Therefore, a process cannot exist in the real world as an independent one. It necessarily exists associated with an event. <Its instance is put into an event instance to exist in the real world.> Although it has a time interval to specify in what time region it exists, both ends of the interval are excluded, that is, the interval is an open interval. Processes are material of events. Linguistically, it corresponds to verbs, while events to nouns. Consider: to travel and a travel.

CONCEPT.LABEL: phenomena
CONCEPT.DEF: No doer. Participants only.

SUB_L.label: 現象
SUB_L.def: No doer. Participants only.

CONCEPT.LABEL: physical action
CONCEPT.DEF: Actions for physical objects.

SUB_L.label: 物理的行為
SUB_L.def: use body

CONCEPT.LABEL: action
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs an intention of the doer. Needless to say, since this is a subclass of process, every instance of this class must be a proces rather than an event. Therefore, it exists in an open time interval: (s-time, e-time).

SUB_L.label: 行為
SUB_L.def: It needs an intention of the doer. Needless to say, since this is a subclass of process, every instance of this class must be a proces rather than an event. Therefore, it exists in an open time interval: (s-time, e-time).

CONCEPT.LABEL: cognitive action
CONCEPT.DEF: Actions in the brain

SUB_L.label: 認知行為
SUB_L.def: use brain

CONCEPT.LABEL: actor achievement action
CONCEPT.DEF: A state of the actor is achieved.

SUB_L.label: 動作主達成型行為
SUB_L.def: A state of the actor is achieved.

CONCEPT.LABEL: abstract
CONCEPT.DEF: It needs neither time nor sapce to exist.

SUB_L.label: 抽象物
SUB_L.def: It needs neither time nor sapce to exist.

CONCEPT.LABEL: intrinsic generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: Essential attribute in a common term.

SUB_L.label: 本質属性
SUB_L.def: Essential attribute in a common term.

CONCEPT.LABEL: accidental generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: non-essential generic quality. There is no clear boundary between intrinsic and accidental generic qualities in theory.

SUB_L.label: 非本質属性
SUB_L.def: non-essential generic quality. There is no clear boundary between intrinsic and accidental generic qualities in theory.

CONCEPT.LABEL: unit
CONCEPT.DEF: It is not The unit that has its own size but a kind of dimension, that is, axis representing kind of quantity. m,cm,Km, etc. are units for representation. Quantity must be representation-independent. See value slot of singleton quantity and "unit-related form". This is a simplified version and should be elaborated more.

SUB_L.label: 単位
SUB_L.def: It is not The unit that has its own size but a kind of dimension, that is, axis representing kind of quantity. m,cm,Km, etc. are units for representation. Quantity must be representation-independent. See value slot of singleton quantity and "unit-related form". This is a simplified version and should be elaborated more.

CONCEPT.LABEL: length
CONCEPT.DEF: Note that its two slots are not p/o slots but a/o slots. This is because their slot values inher in its instance. Furthermore, they are not values themselves but are referring to "length quantity" defined elsewhere. This nicely prevents length instance from being a length quantity. This is very important for generic quality to play quality role. Therefore, there are many instances of length referring to 10cm long, while there is only ONE 10cm long as a quantity in the world.

SUB_L.label: 長さ
SUB_L.def: Note that its two slots are not p/o slots but a/o slots. This is because their slot values inher in its instance. Furthermore, they are not values themselves but are referring to "length quantity" defined elsewhere. This nicely prevents length instance from being a length quantity. This is very important for generic quality to play quality role. Therefore, there are many instances of length referring to 10cm long, while there is only ONE 10cm long as a quantity in the world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: color
CONCEPT.DEF: Color as a kind is a generic quality. Red is a subclass of color and/or a value of color as discussed below, and being red is a property of things. The differentiation between red as a value of color and being red as a property is critical. In summary, there are three kinds of red. It is unary rather than binary just like ordinary classes such as animal, car, etc.

SUB_L.label: 色
SUB_L.def: Color as a kind is a generic quality. Red is a subclass of color and/or a value of color as discussed below, and being red is a property of things. The differentiation between red as a value of color and being red as a property is critical. In summary, there are three kinds of red. It is unary rather than binary just like ordinary classes such as animal, car, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: role
CONCEPT.DEF: Roles are not adequately reflected in YAMATO, since it is already reflected/imbedded in Hozo tool. While ordinary types such as human, table, etc. are defined independently, roles are defined within a context which they necessarily depends on in our role theory [Mizoguchi 07]. In fact, roles are used in defining all the types in YAMATO. These are the reasons why YAMATO does not have to incorporate roles in it. When one uses Hozo with YAMATO, he/she can enjoy maximally the benefits presented by both. See [Mizoguchi 2007] Mizoguchi R., Sunagawa E., Kozaki K. and Kitamura Y.: A Model of Roles within an Ontology Development Tool: Hozo, J. of Applied Ontology, Vol.2, No.2, pp.159-179. Sep. 2007.

SUB_L.def: Role depends on its context.

SUB_L.label: ロール
SUB_L.def: Roles are not adequately reflected in YAMATO, since it is already reflected/imbedded in Hozo tool. While ordinary types such as human, table, etc. are defined independently, roles are defined within a context which they necessarily depends on in our role theory [Mizoguchi 07]. In fact, roles are used in defining all the types in YAMATO. These are the reasons why YAMATO does not have to incorporate roles in it. When one uses Hozo with YAMATO, he/she can enjoy maximally the benefits presented by both. See [Mizoguchi 2007] Mizoguchi R., Sunagawa E., Kozaki K. and Kitamura Y.: A Model of Roles within an Ontology Development Tool: Hozo, J. of Applied Ontology, Vol.2, No.2, pp.159-179. Sep. 2007.

CONCEPT.LABEL: proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: This is the body of the content which can be represented in terms of symbols.

SUB_L.label: 命題
SUB_L.def: This is the body of the content which can be represented in terms of symbols.

CONCEPT.LABEL: fact
CONCEPT.DEF: A happening which is what a human has recognized, that is, the content of the happening which can be explained by the person. The fact itself is an instance of event.

SUB_L.label: 出来事
SUB_L.def: A happening which is what a human has recognized, that is, the content of the happening which can be explained by the person. The fact itself is an instance of event.

CONCEPT.LABEL: designed proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: It is essentially a specification for the production phase(mode) which theoretically follows it and uses it as specification.

SUB_L.label: 設計型命題
SUB_L.def: It is essentially a specification for the production phase(mode) which theoretically follows it and uses it as specification.

CONCEPT.LABEL: product proposition
CONCEPT.DEF: It is directly consumed by endusers. The reason why "action" which includes "productive action" is used is to allow such cases where it is used as a specification. For example, a user might use a novel as specification of how to write a novel.

SUB_L.label: 生産型命題
SUB_L.def: It is directly consumed by endusers. The reason why "action" which includes "productive action" is used is to allow such cases where it is used as a specification. For example, a user might use a novel as specification of how to write a novel.

CONCEPT.LABEL: plan
CONCEPT.DEF: Specification for execution.

SUB_L.label: 計画
SUB_L.def: Specification for execution.

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:楽曲(piece of music)
CONCEPT.DEF: YAMATOのpiece of musicに相当。

SUB_L.label: 楽曲
SUB_L.def: This is specification of how to play it.

CONCEPT.LABEL: specification
CONCEPT.DEF: This is essentially what should be realized using it as specification.

SUB_L.label: 仕様
SUB_L.def: This is essentially what should be realized using it as specification.

CONCEPT.LABEL: painting
CONCEPT.DEF: paintings without a canvas. (see painting_2) This corresponds to what you can see in computer-captured paintings. It still needs canvas to be a perfect individual in the real world.

SUB_L.label: 絵画
SUB_L.def: paintings without a canvas. (see painting_2) This corresponds to what you can see in computer-captured paintings. It still needs canvas to be a perfect individual in the real world.

CONCEPT.LABEL: primitive representation
CONCEPT.DEF: Primitive representation is defined as something composed of representation form and proposition carried by the representation form. The identity exists in its proposition. Although it has another identity as a symbol sequence, it is possessed by its representation form. It is similar to human and human body.

SUB_L.label: 表現
SUB_L.def: Primitive representation is defined as something composed of representation form and proposition carried by the representation form. The identity exists in its proposition. Although it has another identity as a symbol sequence, it is possessed by its representation form. It is similar to human and human body.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representation by symbol
CONCEPT.DEF: Representation in terms of symbols.

SUB_L.label: 記号表現
SUB_L.def: Representation in terms of symbols.

CONCEPT.LABEL: 2D representation
CONCEPT.DEF: Because there is no content denoted/carried by symbols, 2D representation except symbol figure is equivalent to representation form. Both degenerated into one. In other words, representation form itself is the content in the case of 2D representation except symbol figure. It still needs medium to exist in the real world as a physical entity. It is not very concrete because it is not yet drawn on a canvas or the like with paint or ink.

SUB_L.label: ２次元表現
SUB_L.def: Because there is no content denoted/carried by symbols, 2D representation except symbol figure is equivalent to representation form. Both degenerated into one. In other words, representation form itself is the content in the case of 2D representation except symbol figure. It still needs medium to exist in the real world as a physical entity. It is not very concrete because it is not yet drawn on a canvas or the like with paint or ink.

CONCEPT.LABEL: musical score
CONCEPT.DEF: Something composed of musical symbol sequence carrying the specification of how to play it as its content.

SUB_L.label: 楽譜
SUB_L.def: Something composed of musical symbol sequence carrying the specification of how to play it as its content.

CONCEPT.LABEL: text
CONCEPT.DEF: Sequence of sentences

SUB_L.label: テキスト
SUB_L.def: Sequence of sentences

CONCEPT.LABEL: utterance
CONCEPT.DEF: Label is not perfect. It is not a speech-coded yet.

SUB_L.label: 発話
SUB_L.def: Label is not perfect. It is not a speech-coded yet.

CONCEPT.LABEL: representation form
CONCEPT.DEF: This is what is left after extracting its meaning/content from "representation". The heart of this conceptualization is the separation between form and content.

SUB_L.label: 表現形態
SUB_L.def: This is what is left after extracting its meaning/content from "representation". The heart of this conceptualization is the separation between form and content.

CONCEPT.LABEL: image form
CONCEPT.DEF: Because there is no symbol for image, still image is equivalent to 2D representation(painting). Both are degenerated into one. It is not very concrete because it is not yet drawn on a canvas or the like with paint or ink. So, taking line images, they are line figures without ink.

SUB_L.label: 画像
SUB_L.def: Because there is no symbol for image, still image is equivalent to 2D representation(painting). Both are degenerated into one. It is not very concrete because it is not yet drawn on a canvas or the like with paint or ink. So, taking line images, they are line figures without ink.

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:言語(natural language)
CONCEPT.DEF: YAMATOのnatural languageを基にする。 Not language as a kind but language sentence excluding its meaning. The style of sentence is its content.

SUB_L.rh_name: 使用されている文字記号

SUB_L.class_const: 使用されている文字記号

SUB_L.label: 自然言語
SUB_L.def: Not language as a kind but language sentence excluding its meaning. The style of sentence is its content.

CONCEPT.LABEL: line image
CONCEPT.DEF: Physical specification of the image. In the case of line images, it could be equations.

SUB_L.label: 線図形
SUB_L.def: Physical specification of the image. In the case of line images, it could be equations.

CONCEPT.LABEL: unit of length
CONCEPT.DEF: Down to this level, units represent intrinsic nature of unit as a "dimension". Those units lower than this level, such as, m, cm, etc. are those for representation of the corresponding quantities. That is, both "100cm and 1m represents the same quantity. What is essential to the quantity is a quantity of length. See "representation form".

SUB_L.label: 長さ単位
SUB_L.def: Down to this level, units represent intrinsic nature of unit as a "dimension". Those units lower than this level, such as, m, cm, etc. are those for representation of the corresponding quantities. That is, both "100cm and 1m represents the same quantity. What is essential to the quantity is a quantity of length. See "representation form".

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.DEF: This space should be "p-space", since the class constraints of the slots of the subclasses of "location" must be not its subclass but its part.

SUB_L.def: This space should be "p-space", since the class constraints of the slots of the subclasses of "location" must be not its subclass but its part.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Universal
CONCEPT.DEF:
By this, I mean not classes unlike other researchers say which make little sense since they duplicate with the is-a structure of Particulars, but mean concepts which appear in our domain of discourse such as Concept, Instance, State, etc.
This is not seriously elaborated yet.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Instance
CONCEPT.DEF: Every instrance is an instance of this class(Instance).

CONCEPT.LABEL: Concept
CONCEPT.DEF: It corresponds to(counter part of) Instance.

CONCEPT.LABEL: "a"_2
CONCEPT.DEF: This is an instance not of the symbol "a". Its content is equal to the instance of "a" as true alphabet class as a subclas of proposition. Its form is the visible figure, that is, what you see.

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: The specification of the shape(icon) of "a" which virtually exists and is unique in the world.

SUB_L.def: The specification of the shape(icon) of "a" which virtually exists and is unique in the world.

SLOT.label: slot3
SLOT.DEF: This is THE symbol "a" independently of its icon(shape).

SUB_L.def: This is THE symbol "a" independently of its icon(shape).

SUB_L.label: "a"[2]
SUB_L.def: This is an instance not of the symbol "a". Its content is equal to the instance of "a" as true alphabet class as a subclas of proposition. Its form is the visible figure, that is, what you see.

CONCEPT.LABEL: symbol
CONCEPT.DEF: Definition of the figure of a symbol which vertually exists. At the same time, this corresponds to the symbol itself. Theoretically, a symbol is defined as anything which is identified among other symbols and designates some particular thing.

SUB_L.label: 記号
SUB_L.def: Definition of the figure of a symbol which vertually exists. At the same time, this corresponds to the symbol itself. Theoretically, a symbol is defined as anything which is identified among other symbols and designates some particular thing.

CONCEPT.LABEL: "a"
CONCEPT.DEF: This is an instance of alphabet class. The alphabet "a" as an instance of alphabet class exists only ONE in the world. Many "a"s you see are instances of "a" as representation. The content of a symbol, which is being represented by a visible symbol(icon) is inherently invisible. What is visible is a symbol figure which represents the symbol. Although this statement is true, it is rather troublesome to deal with symbols like such. So, we could assume that the invisible symbol is degenerated to (equivalent to) the ideal figure of the symbol which is also invisible because it virtually exists.

SUB_L.label: "あ"(インスタンス)
SUB_L.def: This is an instance of alphabet class. The alphabet "a" as an instance of alphabet class exists only ONE in the world. Many "a"s you see are instances of "a" as representation. The content of a symbol, which is being represented by a visible symbol(icon) is inherently invisible. What is visible is a symbol figure which represents the symbol. Although this statement is true, it is rather troublesome to deal with symbols like such. So, we could assume that the invisible symbol is degenerated to (equivalent to) the ideal figure of the symbol which is also invisible because it virtually exists.

CONCEPT.LABEL: score of the 5th
CONCEPT.DEF: There could be many variations of the score of the same score content according to its form of representation.

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: This is the 5th which is equivalent to the 5th defined as an instance of symphony class as a subclass of proposition.

SUB_L.def: This is the 5th which is equivalent to the 5th defined as an instance of symphony class as a subclass of proposition.

SUB_L.label: 運命の楽譜
SUB_L.def: There could be many variations of the score of the same score content according to its form of representation.

CONCEPT.LABEL: tale of Genji as content
CONCEPT.DEF: This is the tale of Genji which is equivalent to the content slot of tale of Genji(instance) as sentence.

SUB_L.label: 源氏物語の内容(インスタンス)
SUB_L.def: This is the tale of Genji which is equivalent to the content slot of tale of Genji(instance) as sentence.

CONCEPT.LABEL: property
CONCEPT.DEF: This is an abstration of a generic quality taking a quality value. This roughly corrensponds to the conventional "quality", though the definition of quality in YAMATO is a quality role associated with an entity played by a generic quality such as "height of a person". Quality must be free from any particular quality value to cope with its change along time. Precicely speaking, "height of a person" is a qualityrole type and "height of John" is a quality. "John's height of 160cm at time t1" is a quality instance. This term(property) is used mainly for description of quality rather than ontology of quality. The notion of property is consistent with "state" which does NOT compatible with quality type. Consider "hungry" which is compatible with "tall" rather than "length".

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.DEF: Property is derived from a quality value. This slot referrs to the original quantity.

SUB_L.def: Property is derived from a quality value. This slot referrs to the original quantity.

SUB_L.label: 特性
SUB_L.def: This is an abstration of a generic quality taking a quality value. This roughly corrensponds to the conventional "quality", though the definition of quality in YAMATO is a quality role associated with an entity played by a generic quality such as "height of a person". Quality must be free from any particular quality value to cope with its change along time. Precicely speaking, "height of a person" is a qualityrole type and "height of John" is a quality. "John's height of 160cm at time t1" is a quality instance. This term(property) is used mainly for description of quality rather than ontology of quality. The notion of property is consistent with "state" which does NOT compatible with quality type. Consider "hungry" which is compatible with "tall" rather than "length".

CONCEPT.LABEL: being red
CONCEPT.DEF: Quality of being red. It is qualitative and is different from red, a subclass of color, which is a generic quality. See color, red and being long.

SUB_L.label: being赤い
SUB_L.def: Quality of being red. It is qualitative and is different from red, a subclass of color, which is a generic quality. See color, red and being long.

CONCEPT.LABEL: blue

SUB_L.label: 青

SUB_L.label: 連続的行為

CONCEPT.LABEL: state
CONCEPT.DEF: Location-independent. State corresponds not to generic quality but to property. It is possessed by continuants and processes.

SUB_L.label: 状態
SUB_L.def: Location-independent. State corresponds not to generic quality but to property. It is possessed by continuants and processes.

CONCEPT.LABEL: internal state
CONCEPT.DEF: state of the actor ?internal-state is internal of ?holder.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Particular
CONCEPT.DEF: Ordinary top-most type.

SUB_L.label: YAMATO
SUB_L.def: Ordinary top-most type.

CONCEPT.LABEL: Any
CONCEPT.DEF: Relations are organized in another world. Hozo deals with relations and the wholeness concepts (ordinary types) in different worlds. Similarly to Roles, YAMATO implemented in Hozo exploits built-in and user-defined relations. Hozo has three built-in relations: is-a, part-of and attribute-of which are exploited to define types in YAMATO. These are used to introduce fundamental definitions of types, and user-defined relations are used to impose semantic constraints among parts and attributes of a type.

CONCEPT.LABEL: mind

CONCEPT.LABEL: simple action

SUB_L.def: No explicit subaction. Strictly speaking, of course, no action is simple. What are defined here are so-called basic actions which are used to compose complex actions such as shopping, reservation of accommodation, travel, etc.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quantitative generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: It could have either one of the two kinds of values: quantitative or qualitative. This includes typical/ordinary generic qualities such as mass, length, etc. Both slots must be a/o, since its instances shouldn't be equal to the corresponding quantity but a reference to the corresponding quantity. See length.

SUB_L.class_const: 定性的量 | カテゴリカル

SUB_L.def: It could have either one of the two kinds of values: quantitative or qualitative. This includes typical/ordinary generic qualities such as mass, length, etc. Both slots must be a/o, since its instances shouldn't be equal to the corresponding quantity but a reference to the corresponding quantity. See length.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quality value

SUB_L.label: 属性値

CONCEPT.LABEL: human body
CONCEPT.DEF: To avoid redundancy, each body part should be defined in the corresponding slots of human body rather than in body part. Is-a relations between each part of a body(head, eye, arm, etc.) and "body part" are automatically generated by Hozo as well as those between each part and its whole. For example of the latter kinds, head[RH] is-a head portion[RH], head-portion[RH] is-a human body, arm[RH] is-a human body, etc. are generated. These is-a relations are accessible when you use "p-" operator like "p-human body" in a class constraint.

SUB_L.label: 人体
SUB_L.def: To avoid redundancy, each body part should be defined in the corresponding slots of human body rather than in body part. Is-a relations between each part of a body(head, eye, arm, etc.) and "body part" are automatically generated by Hozo as well as those between each part and its whole. For example of the latter kinds, head[RH] is-a head portion[RH], head-portion[RH] is-a human body, arm[RH] is-a human body, etc. are generated. These is-a relations are accessible when you use "p-" operator like "p-human body" in a class constraint.

CONCEPT.DEF: It has uncontrollable but common intention. Each member shares the same goal and action, and at the same time, the crowd enacts the same action as a whole. See [Galton 2009] in detail.

CONCEPT.LABEL: event
CONCEPT.DEF: An event is a wholeness type which has unity. It is not Open-ended in the sense that it has specified either starting or ending or middle(pass-by event) events. It can't change. It is state-less. It is not dissective. Every existence is an instance of an event. Any object cannot exist without participating in an event. For example, Mr. A, an instance of human cannot exist in the real world as it is alone, but must exist as a participant slot filler of an event/process instance with some action which he might be perfoming at all times. It is different from an instance of an action which is a process and is a part of an event instance. It is a bare event that exists independently of human recognition(before recognition). It follows B-series of time.

SLOT.label: slot
SLOT.class_constraint: evt:時間区分(time interval) | time point

SLOT.label: slot2
SLOT.class_constraint: evt:時間区分(time interval) | time point

SLOT.label: slot4
SLOT.DEF: このイベントが起こる前に必ず起こっていなくてはならないイベント。 このイベントと、参加者を共有する。

SUB_L.label: slot
SUB_L.def: このイベントが起こる前に必ず起こっていなくてはならないイベント。 このイベントと、参加者を共有する。

SUB_L.label: イベント
SUB_L.def: Every existence is an instance of Event. Any object cannot exist without participating in an Event. For example, Mr. A, an instance of human cannot exist in the real world as it is, but can as the participant slot filler of an Event instance with some action which he might be perfoming at the certain time. It is different from an instance of an action which is a part of Event instance like Mr. A. It is a bare event which exists independently of human recognition(before recognition). "event" is what human recognized and is eventually/potentially informed to others or prcessed in his/her brain for futher inference.

CONCEPT.LABEL: quantity
CONCEPT.DEF: It is just a quantity independent of what quantity it is of. That is, 10cm and 11cm exist just as it is in the quantity space and are just different. On the other hand, when a thing's length is 10cm long at time t1 and 11cm long at t2, we say the length of the thing CHANGED. The 10cm long of a thing has its identity which persists having possibly different values. Note that quantity is not specifically dependent on anything, but generically dependent on physical entity.

SUB_L.def: Generically dependent on physical entity.

CONCEPT.LABEL: forward
CONCEPT.DEF: This kind of generic qualities has the same direction of increase of its dimension, that is, when the value becomes larger, then the generic quality gain more strength. The reason is as follows: When you have a dimension, you can go two directions: to the value-increasine direction and to the value-decreasing direction. Most of such an axes are "named" or "conceptualized" based on the "value-increasing direction". Let's take an example of length dimension. The value-increasing direction is said "long" and the value-decreasing direction "short". The point here is the asix is NOT called "shortness" BUT "length" which implies "long". This way of naming/conceptualization, we call it "forward" way of conceptualization, dominates and seems very universal. However, there are some exceptional cases in I_O relational attributes. While "conductivity" is a forward conceptualization, "insulative" or "insulativitiy" is not. It is what we call "backward" by which we mean it gains its strength by going to the value-decreasing direction on the axis.

SUB_L.label: 順方向
SUB_L.def: This kind of generic qualities has the same direction of increase of its dimension, that is, when the value becomes larger, then the generic quality gain more strength. The reason is as follows: When you have a dimension, you can go two directions: to the value-increasine direction and to the value-decreasing direction. Most of such an axes are "named" or "conceptualized" based on the "value-increasing direction". Let's take an example of length dimension. The value-increasing direction is said "long" and the value-decreasing direction "short". The point here is the asix is NOT called "shortness" BUT "length" which implies "long". This way of naming/conceptualization, we call it "forward" way of conceptualization, dominates and seems very universal. However, there are some exceptional cases in I_O relational attributes. While "conductivity" is a forward conceptualization, "insulative" or "insulativitiy" is not. It is what we call "backward" by which we mean it gains its strength by going to the value-decreasing direction on the axis.

CONCEPT.LABEL: generic quality
CONCEPT.DEF: This is an abstraction of the kinds at the class level. In the use case, it is sometimes referred to with # operator as a class constraint like "#generic quality". In a common term, it would be called "attribute". Its instance is not equal to its value. The value itself belongs to "quality value". Its instance is still an attribute which refers to a specific quantity. Its instnace plays a quality role like length plays one's height as a quality role. Quality such as one's height, one's weight, etc. are roles, and hence must be defined in the context of respective contexts(entities). Therefore, they are not defined as basic type like length, weight, etc. See "physical" in which a most generic quality is defined. Quality in DOLCE corresponds to quality role type in YAMATO. This is why "quality" is invisible in YAMATO in spite of it knows "quality". See YAMATO paper(attached document).

SUB_L.label: 属性
SUB_L.def: This is an abstraction of the kinds at the class level. In the use case, it is sometimes referred to with # operator as a class constraint like "#generic quality". In a common term, it would be called "attribute". Its instance is not equal to its value. The value itself belongs to "quality value". Its instance is still an attribute which refers to a specific quantity. Its instnace plays a quality role like length plays one's height as a quality role. Quality such as one's height, one's weight, etc. are roles, and hence must be defined in the context of respective contexts(entities). Therefore, they are not defined as basic type like length, weight, etc. See "physical" in which a most generic quality is defined. Quality in DOLCE corresponds to quality role type in YAMATO. This is why "quality" is invisible in YAMATO in spite of it knows "quality". See YAMATO paper(attached document).

Note that the two "thresholds" must share the same unit-related representation to avoid invalid comparison such as between those using m and cm.

CONCEPT.LABEL: extrinsic accomplishment
CONCEPT.DEF: It is constituted by ordinary processes(actions) by adding the starting event and ending event. Any process (t1, t2) can be tranformed to an event by adding a starting event and an ending event which eventually lasts [t1, t2].

SUB_L.def: It is constituted by ordinary processes(actions) by adding the starting event and ending event. Any process (t1, t2) can be tranformed to an event by adding a starting event and an ending event which eventually lasts [t1, t2].

SUB_L.label: 本来的完遂
SUB_L.def: It is an accomplishment by itself alone. See extrinsic accomplishment.

CONCEPT.LABEL: generically dependent

SUB_L.def: It needs a particular individual to exist.

evt:同一のロールを持つ集団(crowd which shares a role)
evt:complex intrinsic accomplishment
CONCEPT.DEF: 必ずsubeventを持つintrinsic accomplishment。 考え方によっては、どのようなイベントも必ずsubeventを持つが、ここで挙げているものは、明確なagent, themeなどが決定できず、subeventの複合体と見なせるものである。 ｓいわゆる「名前付きイベント」で、その開始や終了、影響範囲が、人間による認識を超え、社会における合意などによって決定される場合がある。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:simple intrinsic accomplishment
CONCEPT.DEF: 明確なsubeventを持たないintrinsic accomplishment。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:史実としての産業(industry as historical fact)
evt:事故(accident)
CONCEPT.DEF: 思いがけず起こった悪い出来ごと。また、支障。（広辞苑 第六版 「事故」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:災害(disaster)
CONCEPT.DEF: 異常な自然現象や人為的原因によって、人間の社会生活や人命に受ける被害。（広辞苑 第六版 「災害」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:軍事行動・戦役(military campaign as historical fact)
CONCEPT.DEF: 国家が兵力を以てする一切の行動。（広辞苑 第六版 「軍事行動」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:国家間戦争・紛争(interstate war)
CONCEPT.DEF: 武力による国家間の闘争。（広辞苑 第六版 「戦争」二） 交戦勢力の両方が国家である戦争、あるいは国家とその国家外の勢力との戦争を含む。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:内戦・内乱・国内紛争(intrastate conflict)
CONCEPT.DEF: 国内で起こる戦争。内戦・反乱含む

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:戦闘(battle)
CONCEPT.DEF: 戦闘（せんとう、英: Combat, Battle、羅: proeliumプロエリウム）とは、相互に敵対する二つの勢力による暴力の相互作用である。戦斗、戰闘とも。 戦闘が行われている場所を戦場（せんじょう）、戦地といい、歴史的に戦闘（合戦など）が行われた場所は古戦場（こせんじょう）と呼ぶことがある。歴史的な慣習によって、「―の戦い」、「―の合戦」、「―の会戦」という用語も用いられる。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%88%A6%E9%97%98)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:革命(revolution)
CONCEPT.DEF: ある状態が急激に発展、変動すること。（広辞苑 第六版 「革命」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:自然災害(natural disaster)
CONCEPT.DEF: 地震・火山爆発・津波・高潮・台風・豪雨・洪水・異常低温などの自然現象によってひき起こされる災害。火災・交通事故・公害などのような社会的（人為的）災害と区別される。（広辞苑 第六版 「自然災害」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:公害(environmental pollution)
CONCEPT.DEF: 企業活動によって地域住民のこうむる環境災害。煤煙・有毒ガスによる大気汚染、排水・廃液による河川・地下水の汚濁、地下水の大量採取による地盤沈下、機械や工場の騒音・振動・悪臭など。（広辞苑 第六版 「公害」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:人的災害(human-caused disaster)
CONCEPT.DEF: 火災・交通事故・公害など、人為的に引き起こされるもの。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:危機(crisis)
CONCEPT.DEF: 危機（きき）とは、安全、経済、政治、社会、環境等の面で、個人、組織、コミュニティ、もしくは社会全体に対して不安定かつ危険な状況をもたらす、もしくはもたらしかねない突発的な出来事のことである。英語のクライシス（crisis / 複数形: crises）は、ギリシア語の「クリシス」（κρίσις）に由来している[1]。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8D%B1%E6%A9%9F) ここでは主に、国際危機と経済危機をカバーする。公害等の環境危機は「災害」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:事件(incident)
CONCEPT.DEF: （意外な）できごと。もめごと。（広辞苑 第六版 「事件」二） クーデター、暴動、デモ、公害、犯罪行為などを下位イベントに含む複合的なイベント。宣戦布告前の戦闘事件も含む（盧溝橋事件など）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:遠征(expedition)
CONCEPT.DEF: 遠くに出かけること。遠行。特に、遠くに征伐に行くこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「遠征」一） 遠方に出向いて戦争をする。

SUB_L.class_const: evt:弱いエージェントの移動(moving)

SUB_L.def: 遠方に出向いて戦争をする。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:独立戦争(war of independence)
CONCEPT.DEF: 独立戦争（どくりつせんそう、Wars of Independence, Wars of National Liberation, National Liberation Revolutions）とは、国家の支配下にある地域が独立を目的として起こす戦争のことである。独立要求運動が武力闘争から戦争に発展したものであり、その点で既存の政権の奪取を目的とするクーデターや、同一の主権国家の連続として政治体制の変革を目的とする革命とは異なる。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%8B%AC%E7%AB%8B%E6%88%A6%E4%BA%89)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:agentive simple intinric accomplishment
CONCEPT.DEF: agentが関わるsimple intrinsic accomplishment。意図的なイベント。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:創造(creating)
CONCEPT.DEF: 新たに造ること。新しいものを造りはじめること。（広辞苑 第六版 「創造」一）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:作成(making)
CONCEPT.DEF: 人工物あるいはコンテンツを作る。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:建造物の建設(building)
CONCEPT.DEF: 建設造営すること。建物・船など大きな構造のものをつくること。（広辞苑 第六版 「建造」）

SUB_L.def: 建設造営すること。建物・船など大きな構造のものをつくること。（広辞苑 第六版 「建造」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:著作(authoring)
CONCEPT.DEF: 書物をあらわしつくること。著述。（広辞苑 第六版 「著作」）

SUB_L.def: 書物をあらわしつくること。著述。（広辞苑 第六版 「著作」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:絵画の制作(painting)
CONCEPT.DEF: 絵画作品を作る。

SUB_L.def: 絵画作品を作る。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:彫刻の制作(carving)
CONCEPT.DEF: 彫刻作品を作る。

SUB_L.def: 彫刻作品を作る。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:組織の設立(founding)
CONCEPT.DEF: 法人などの組織を新たに作り設けること。（広辞苑 第六版 「設立」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:建国(founding of a nation)
CONCEPT.DEF: 国家を建てる。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:(建造物としての)都市(city as a construction)
evt:考案(devising)
CONCEPT.DEF: コンテンツを考え出す。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:法・制度・政策の制定(instituting)
evt:イベントを起こす(causing of an event)
CONCEPT.DEF: 弱いエージェントが意図的にイベントを発生させる。 出来事が他の出来事を誘発する場合は「誘発」へ。

SUB_L.class_const: evt:イベントの発生(occurrence of an event)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:撲滅(annihilating)
CONCEPT.DEF: うちほろぼすこと。ほろぼし絶やすこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「撲滅」） 存在しているものを、存在しないようにするイベント。ものの（完全な）破壊、人物の殺害、制度の廃止など。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:オブジェクトの完全な破壊(destruction)
CONCEPT.DEF: 自然物や人工物を、復元不可能な状態にする。 形あるいは機能を部分的に、復元可能な程度に壊す場合は「損傷」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:組織の廃止・壊滅(abolishment or annihilation of an organization)
evt:法・制度・政策の廃止(abolishment of a rule)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:発言(stating)
CONCEPT.DEF: 口頭で意見をのべること。（広辞苑 第六版 「発言」二） 口に出して事実や意見を述べる行為。一人または複数の相手と話す場合は「会話」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:公的な発表
CONCEPT.DEF: 世の中へおもてむきに知らせること。大勢の人々に示すこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「発表」一）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:思想の主張(advocating of a thought)
evt:政治上の革命(political revolution)
CONCEPT.DEF: 従来の被支配階級が支配階級から国家権力を奪い、社会組織を急激に変革すること。（広辞苑 第六版 「革命」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:文化における革命(cultural revolution)
evt:所有(having)
CONCEPT.DEF: 自分のものとして持っていること。（広辞苑 第六版 「所有」より） 権利として持つ。「手に持つ」「携行する」などは「所持」へ。

SUB_L.def: 自分のものとして持っていること。（広辞苑 第六版 「所有」より）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:始める(starting or initiating)
CONCEPT.DEF: 弱いエージェントが、出来事などを新たに開始する。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:終える(finishing)
CONCEPT.DEF: それまで続いていた出来事を済ませ、終わりにする。 出来事がまだ途中の状態でやめる場合は、「停止させる(cessation)」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:消滅(extinction)
CONCEPT.DEF: 消えてなくなること。消してなくすこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「消滅」） ここでは、人物の死亡なども含め、「存在しなくなる」こと全般を含む。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:人物の死亡(death of a person)
evt:発生・成立(occurrence/birth/formation)
CONCEPT.DEF: 存在の開始。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:組織の成立(emergence of a organization)
evt:国家の成立(emergence of a nation)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:国家の独立(attaining of independence of a nation)
CONCEPT.DEF: 国家の独立とは、既存の主権国家に属する領域（領土）の一部や従属領域（植民地、保護国、従属国などを含む）が、元の国家領域や宗主国などから分離独立することを指す。また、無主地やどの主権国家にも属していない領域が新たに国家を建設する場合も、独立と呼ぶことができる。ただし、既存の国家が合併した場合は、独立とはよばない。なお、「独立」の反対語は「従属」または「併合」である。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9B%BD%E5%AE%B6%E3%81%AE%E7%8B%AC%E7%AB%8B)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:喪失(losing things)
CONCEPT.DEF: なくすこと。失うこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「喪失」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:退任(resigning)
CONCEPT.DEF: 役職を退く。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:承認(acknowledgement)
CONCEPT.DEF: 事実や権利、法などの存在や正当性を認める行為。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:征服(conquest)
CONCEPT.DEF:
征服（せいふく、英語：conquest）とは、武力・軍事力によって敵を負かして支配下におくこと、武力征伐によって相手を屈服させることであり、歴史的には国家や民族集団が武力によって他の国家や領域を占領、併合し、消滅させる全過程を指している。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%BE%81%E6%9C%8D)
軍事力によって支配下に置く。征服後に支配が続いている状態は支配イベントへ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:参加(participating)
CONCEPT.DEF: なかまになること。行事・会合・団体などに加わること。（広辞苑 第六版 「参加」一）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:宗教的声明(religious statement)
CONCEPT.DEF: 95カ条の論題など。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:概念としての通貨(currency as a concept)
CONCEPT.DEF: 概念としての通貨。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:詩(poetry)
CONCEPT.DEF: 叙事詩、叙情詩、歌なども含む。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:哲学書・神学書(book on philosophy or theology)
evt:政治・経済・法に関する書(academic book on politics, economics, and law)
evt:宗教書・教典(religious text or scripture)
evt:全般的な美術様式(general art style)
CONCEPT.DEF: 絵画、彫刻、工芸、建築、音楽に至るまでカバーする様式。ロマネスク、アールヌーボーなど。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:その他のグループ
CONCEPT.DEF: 「三大悲劇詩人」など。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:存在(existing)
CONCEPT.DEF: ある、または、いること。（広辞苑 第六版 「存在」一） 特定の場所に存在するのではなく、現実世界に存在するというイベント。 特定の場所への存在は「特定の場所での存在」へ。

SUB_L.def: 特定の場所に存在するのではなく、現実世界に存在するというイベント。 特定の場所への存在は「特定の場所での存在」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:戦い(fighting)
CONCEPT.DEF: 二つのagentが互いに相手を物理的に屈服、あるいは殲滅するための行為。 社会や経済における競争、精神的な戦いや情報戦、運動競技における試合、技能のコンテスト、娯楽のためのゲームなどは含まない。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:催し物(organized event)
CONCEPT.DEF: 人を集めて行う会合や演芸・展示などの行事。（広辞苑 第六版 「催し物」） 会議、博覧会、競技会、式典など、人間が事前に計画、準備して行う複合的なイベント。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:会議(meeting)
CONCEPT.DEF: 会合して評議すること。何かを決めるため集まって話し合うこと。その会合。（広辞苑 第六版 「会議」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:博覧会(exhibition)
CONCEPT.DEF: 種々の産物を蒐集展示して公衆の観覧および購買に供し、産業・文化の振興を期するために開催する会。（広辞苑 第六版 「博覧会」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:競技会(athletic competition)
CONCEPT.DEF: 競技（きょうぎ）とは、一定のルールに従い、争う分野。または、遊戯（ゲーム）[1]。競い合い優劣を決めることをテーマとしたものを競技会（大会）という。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%AB%B6%E6%8A%80%E4%BC%9A)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:始まる(occurrence of an event)
CONCEPT.DEF: 出来事が開始する。

evt:法律・体制・制度の成立

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:許可(authorization)
CONCEPT.DEF: 許すこと。願いを聞きとどけること。（広辞苑 第六版 「許可」一）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:授与(giving)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:繁栄(prospering)
CONCEPT.DEF: さかえること。繁昌。（広辞苑 第六版 「繁栄」） 文化や国家、経済活動が発展する。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:主張(advocating)
CONCEPT.DEF: 自分の説を強く言いはること。（広辞苑 第六版 「主張」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:領土の割譲(ceding of territory)
CONCEPT.DEF: 所有権の移動を伴う。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:譲渡
CONCEPT.DEF: （権利・財産などを）ゆずり渡すこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「譲渡」） 所有権をagentからgoalに移す。agentはthemeの所有権を失う。 所有権の移動が必ずしも伴わない場合（権利を与えるなど）は「授与」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:占領(occupation)
CONCEPT.DEF: 占領（せんりょう）、正確には軍事占領（ military occupation）[1]とは他国の領土、拠点、政経中枢などを軍が占有・占拠することをいう。ハーグ陸戦条約42条においては、敵国領土（租借地、準領土を含む）内に侵入した軍隊が、敵国の権力を排除し、一定の地域を自国の権力内において統治することを指す[2]。（wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8D%A0%E9%A0%98)

CONCEPT.DEF: 活動や政策を推進する。物理的に物体が「前進する」イベントは含まない。 物事が進むように人々の心理に働きかける場合は「奨励」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:抵抗(countering)
CONCEPT.DEF: 外からの力に対し、張り合いさからうこと。反抗。てむかい。（広辞苑 第六版 「抵抗」より） 弱いエージェントが、他の弱いエージェント、出来事、あるいはコンテンツに対して、心理的あるいは物理的に逆らう。 ここでは、物理的な力の働きなど（電気抵抗など）は含まない。

SUB_L.def: 人間が自然に働きかけて、人にとって有用な財・サービスを作り出すこと、もしくは獲得すること。（広辞苑 第六版 「生産」三）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:併合(annexation)
CONCEPT.DEF: 政治の分野でいう併合（へいごう、annexation）は、ある国の領土の全部または一部が、他国の完全な主権下に置かれることを指す。主権の完全移行を伴わない占領や保護国・保護領化、租借とは区別される。 武力を背景とした一方的な併合の場合、第三国が併合を承認せず、地図上では併合前の国境が用いられることもある。イスラエルによる東エルサレム併合や、イラクによるクウェート併合などでその例が見られる。 「併合」は、強い側の拡張主義や、強制的 / 片務的意味合いが強いため、ときには合併、合邦、統合、統一などといったよりポジティブなイメージを持つ用語に置き換えられることがある。。（Wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BD%B5%E5%90%88)

SUB_L.class_const: 地理オブジェクト | evt:国家・王朝(nation)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:侵攻(invasion)
CONCEPT.DEF: 侵攻（しんこう、invasion）とは、ある国家・武装勢力が別の国家・武装勢力に対して攻撃を仕掛けて、その領土・勢力圏を侵す行為を指す軍事学上の用語。自衛の対義語である国際法用語としての侵略（aggression）とは異なり、必ずしも相手方の主権や政治的独立を一方的に侵す目的とは限らない、価値中立的な概念である。(wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BE%B5%E6%94%BB) 他国または他の領土を攻めおかすこと。侵犯。（広辞苑 第六版 「侵攻」）

CONCEPT.DEF: 気をつけてまもること。かばうこと。ほうご。（広辞苑 第六版 「保護」） 主に仕組みや工夫によって、他のものの影響あるいは妨害から、人間、組織、活動、思想などを守る。

SUB_L.label: evt:信奉

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:衰退(going into a decline)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:完成させる(completing)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:朝貢(tribute)
CONCEPT.DEF: ある国が別の国の朝廷に貢物を捧げること。貿易の一形態。 wikipedia: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9C%9D%E8%B2%A2

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:争い・対立の調停(mediating a conflict)
CONCEPT.DEF: 当事者双方の間に第三者が介入して争いをやめさせること。（広辞苑 第六版 「調停」一） 対立している当事者の間に入って、争いや対立をやめさせようとすること。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:上回る(exceeding)
CONCEPT.DEF: 一定の限度・程度をこえること。こえまさること。（広辞苑 第六版 「超過」） 数量、程度が特定の基準を上回ること。 単純な増加は「増加」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:規定(specifying)
CONCEPT.DEF: 規則などによる指定。causerは人間ではなく規則などのコンテンツ。人間による決定は「決定」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:当選(winning an election)
CONCEPT.DEF: 選挙において選出される。 宝くじなどの当選は別イベントへ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:落選(losing an election)
CONCEPT.DEF: 選挙における落選。 宝くじなどの落選は別イベントへ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:教育(educating)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:教授(teaching)
CONCEPT.DEF: 学術・技芸などを教えること。養護・訓練とならぶ教育上の基本的な活動・作用。（広辞苑 第六版 「教授」一） 人間が、他の人間に特定の学問や技術を授ける。 全般的な教育を受けさせる場合は「教育」へ。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:処罰(punishing)
CONCEPT.DEF: 罰に処すること。罰すること。（広辞苑 第六版 「処罰」） 罪や過失を犯したweak agentに罰を与えること。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:制裁(sanction)
CONCEPT.DEF: 道徳・慣習または法規・申合せなどにそむいた者を、こらしめのために罰すること。（広辞苑 第六版 「制裁」） 法律や制度、慣習に基づいて罰すること。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:付加(adding)
CONCEPT.DEF: あるものの上にさらに添える。つけたす。付加する。（広辞苑 第六版 「付け加える」） ものや概念に、新しい部分や特徴を付け加える。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:侵略(aggression)
CONCEPT.DEF: 侵略（しんりゃく、aggression）とは、国際法上、ある国家・武装勢力が別の国家・武装勢力に対して、自衛ではなく、一方的にその主権・領土や独立を侵すことを意味する。軍事学概念としての侵攻（invasion）が目的を問わず相手方勢力・領域を攻撃する行動を指すのとは異なり、相手の主権・政治的独立を奪う目的の有無に注目した用語である。(wikipedia http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BE%B5%E7%95%A5) 他国に侵入してその領土や財物を奪いとること。（広辞苑 第六版 「侵略」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:講和(concluding a peace)

CONCEPT.DEF: 刑法上は、人の行動の自由を拘束すること。刑事訴訟法上は、捜査機関が裁判官の発する令状（逮捕状）により被疑者を引致し、短期間抑留するための強制手段。現行犯人は、逮捕状なしに誰でも逮捕できる。（広辞苑 第六版 「逮捕」二）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:釈放
CONCEPT.DEF: 自由を拘束されている者、特に刑事施設に拘禁されている者の拘束を解くこと。（広辞苑 第六版 「釈放」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:拘禁(inprisonment)

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:妨害(interfering)
CONCEPT.DEF: さまたげること。じゃますること。（広辞苑 第六版 「妨害」） 特に、他人の行動を、その人にとって害悪になるような形で抑制する。

SUB_L.def: さまたげること。じゃますること。（広辞苑 第六版 「妨害」）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:抑止(deterring)
CONCEPT.DEF: おさえとどめること。（広辞苑 第六版 「抑止」） 他人の行動や、現象の進行を押さえる。すでに起こりかけていることを、それ以上進まないようにする。ｓ

SUB_L.label: slot
SUB_L.class_const: 生起物 | 弱いエージェント

SUB_L.def: おさえとどめること。（広辞苑 第六版 「抑止」） 他人の行動や、現象の進行を押さえる。すでに起こりかけていることを、それ以上進まないようにする。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:防止(preventing)
CONCEPT.DEF: さえぎる。害を受けないようにする。（広辞苑 第六版 「防ぐ）二） 災害、犯罪など、好ましくないことが起こらないよう、事前に措置を講じる。

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:防衛(defending)
CONCEPT.DEF: 侵そうとするものをくいとめる。番をする。守備する。保護する。（広辞苑 第六版 「防衛」三）

CONCEPT.LABEL: evt:配置(locating)
